diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis with obstruction of the cystic duct by a stone
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with sudden onset severe epigastric pain, fever, and imaging revealed a cystic duct stone. Blood cultures were positive for GNRs, and her abdominal exam noted tenderness in the RUQ. These findings, together with the history of gallstones, led to the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
